comments.content:
I guess C is correct.

DBCA also configures your Oracle RAC environment for various Oracle high availability features, such as cluster administration tools.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
A. Correct: A server pool must be created with SRVCTL before creating a policy-managed RAC database that uses that server pool for a service.
B. Correct: Services can be policy managed for a multitenant database.
C. Incorrect: DBCA does not create new server pools; SRVCTL is used for server pool creation.
D. Correct: Services can be administrator managed for a multitenant database.
E. Incorrect: Singleton services are permitted for multitenant databases.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about the services created when the DBCA is used to create a RAC database? (Choose three.)

choices.D: They can be administrator managed for a multitenant database.
choices.A: A server pool must be created with SRVCTL before creating a policy-managed RAC database that uses that server pool for a service.
choices.E: Singleton services are not permitted for multitenant databases.
choices.B: They can be policy managed for a multitenant database.
choices.C: Policy-managed services specified for a database allow the creation of a new server pool using DBCA.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
CD are explained here: https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/cncpt/physical-storage-structures.html#GUID-7FEC2249-4A21-4967-B951-8979D72030AF

E is correct because rdbm instance doesn't know about ASM redundancy so ASM instance is owner of mirroring process

comments.content: A is bad writted so I think is incorrect because IOServer is not an Oracle ASM instance: https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/ostmg/manage-flex-asm.html

choices.C: Database instances perform read I/O directly to ASM Disks.
choices.A: Database instances perform read I/O using an ASM instance as an I/O Server.
choices.E: If a database instance writes to an ASM-based datafile whose redundancy attribute is set to mirror, then the ASM instance writes the mirror copy.
choices.D: ASM instances can write metadata to ASM diskgroups.
choices.B: Database instances can write metadata to ASM diskgroups.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about accessing ASM files? (Choose three.)
Which statement describes the usage of Dynamic Service Fallback in Oracle RAC 19c?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Sure of D

choices.A: Dynamic Service Fallback allows a service to relocate to an available instance when the service is stopped on a preferred instance.
choices.C: To enable Dynamic Service Fallback, you should specify the level of performance of a preferred instance for a service to be relocated to an available instance by setting the -failback attribute of a service to "Low, Medium, or High".
choices.B: Dynamic Service Fallback allows a service to fall back to a preferred instance when the available instance performance falls below a specified threshold after it was failed over to an available instance.
choices.D: Dynamic Service Fallback allows a service to fall back to a preferred instance when it becomes available after it was failed over to an available instance.

questions.question_text:
Examine these descriptions of ASM instance shutdown behavior:
1) The ASM instance shuts down immediately without an orderly dismount of disk groups.
2) Active SQL statements are allowed to complete before an orderly dismount of all disk groups occurs and then the ASM instance shuts down without waiting for connected sessions to disconnect. If any ASM clients are connected to the instance, then the shutdown returns an error.
3) Active SQL statements are allowed to complete before an orderly dismount of all of disk groups occurs and then the ASM instance shuts down after waiting for connected sessions to disconnect. If any ASM clients are connected to the instance, then the shutdown returns an error.
Which two lists are correct matches for these descriptions? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
IMMEDIATE = TRANSACTIONAL as in ASM there aren't transactions.. As explained here: https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/ostmg/admin-asm-instance.html#GUID-9C2208C8-B436-4A18-A5D7-0CE854751529

Selected Answer: CE
CE correct answer.

Selected Answer: BE
Based on the descriptions, the correct matches are:

Description 1 (immediate shutdown without orderly dismount) matches ABORT.
Description 2 (complete active SQL, then shutdown without waiting for sessions) matches IMMEDIATE.
Description 3 (complete active SQL, then shutdown after waiting for sessions) matches NORMAL.
Therefore, the correct matches are:

B. 2 = NORMAL, 3 = IMMEDIATE, 1 = ABORT
E. 3 = NORMAL, 2 = IMMEDIATE, 1 = ABORT

Selected Answer: CE
...not sure but I think D is wrong - ASM get an abort signal - "shuts down immediately withoul an orderly dismount of diskgroups".

choices.E: To improve performance a database must have two disk groups; one for data and one for the fast recovery area.
choices.D: All ASM Disks belonging to a disk group should have the same hardware specifications and storage attributes for optimal performance.
choices.B: All ASM Disks belonging to a disk group should be of the same size for optimal performance.
choices.A: Data files, redo logs, and RMAN backup pieces must be stored in different ASM disk groups for optimal performance.
choices.C: Hardware-based mirroring combined with ASM mirroring guarantees optimal performance.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about Oracle Clustered ASM performance? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
A: This is not required for optimal performance. Storing data files, redo logs, and RMAN backup pieces in different disk groups is a common practice for organization and management purposes, but it is not a strict requirement for performance.

C: Combining hardware-based mirroring with ASM mirroring does not necessarily guarantee optimal performance; it can add unnecessary overhead.

E: While having separate disk groups for data and the fast recovery area can be a good practice for management, it is not strictly necessary for performance.
